result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashad E. Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rashad E. Coleman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rashad E. Coleman was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay fine of $100.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the Defendant's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashad E. Coleman

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

2:42 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rashad E. Coleman in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Rashad E. Coleman. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 1 day sentence credit if revoked. Court orders a fine in the amount of $100 and court costs. Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

08:58 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Rashad E. Coleman, appeared with Attorney Erin J. Preston.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: State files an amended information. Attorney Preston will waive the reading of the amended information. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Minutes:  9:49am.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Erin Preston.  Deft/defense counsel has no objection to Judge Gabriele handling the case.  Defense counsel reports the case is not resolved to date; needs time to review add'l discovery.  No objection by the State to the deft's adjournment request.  FPT adj to 8/12/22 @ 8:45am.

Defendant, Rashad E. Coleman, appeared with Attorney Erin J. Preston.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DE has been appointed SPD Attorney.  Court does not review advocate counsel petition.
